Creating trust in a rental sharing economy

Using 360° VR to create trust among the students and the landlords leading to higher intention to rent

CLIENT ETTTAK AB

LOCATION Stockholm

DURATION 4 months

CONTRIBUTION Individual Contributor

🧑‍🔧 The Problem

Building trust among the students and the landlords leading to higher intention to rent

I joined Etttak team to do a research project as part of my Master programme. The team had 2 co-founders.

🥅 Goals


To provide students with an easy access to elderly landlords without having to visit the rental home and affordable housing in cut throat market of Stockholm.
Goal 1


To provide elderly landlords with someone to co-live and also a source of income.
Goal 2

🤠 Outcomes


The usability study showed strong favor for 360° Video VR over regular platforms and better preparedness to meet face to face with the landlords
Outcome 1


Students felt confident about the choice they were making and showed more trust on landlords when they should see them talking in VR video.
Outcome 2

🔬 Arriving at the Research Question

Swedish study portal estimates it is very difficult to get accommodation in Stockholm for students. Etttak came up with a platform to connect senior landlords with spare space (55+) and students.

What is the impact of innovative interaction techniques like VR 360° video on trustworthiness among tenants and landlords leading to the intention to rent a home?

👨🏽‍🏫 Theoretical Foundations

The trust model identifies trust in two dimenstions - Technology and Interpersonal. The model was adapted from relevant literature study.

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Customer Journey Map

The journey map details what steps a user takes and expects from Etttak while searching for an accommodation.

📜 Pre-Study and Choice of Methods

Why User Interviews?

User interviews seemed to be correct choice for this project as I needed to gain insights with open ended questions and wanted to give free choice to students to express themselves.

There were 5 interviews in total. I used Thematic Analysis to create 3 category codes for the insights. Thematic analysis is very helpful in identifying recurring points in a dataset.

Expectations from the home such as pictures, location, comfort, amenities and price

Expectations from the landlord such as relationship, rules, manners, clear communication, interests

Improvements in current practices such as more pictures, transparency, local language support

✨ Unity Prototyping - Why and How?

From the initial research question and insights from the user interviews, I decided that a 360° Video in VR would be best to address the needs of students looking for an accommodation since 360° video can give an immersive feeling of the house and the landlord can talk about the needs of the student.

A-Frame (a Javascript framework for WebVR) was chosen initially but then I switched directly to UNITY prototyping since I found that it is not very difficult to learn.

🧁 Results

Why a usability study for this project?

The time frame for the research project was approximately 4 months. So, I could get limited number of participants. Quantitative methods like "Exploratory Factor Analysis" require above 50 participants. So, usability study was a good choice.

A total of 6 participants were tested. I conducted both a survey and post study interviews.

Post study interviews were transcribed and thematically analysed to reveal 5 categories.

Felt very immersive as if students were there in the house

4 Students enjoyed the 360° experience

2 Students points out the video could be of better quality

2 Students felt dizziness and did not want to continue

Intention varied - 1 student was ready to use it. Others would wait for VR to become mainstream

🔮 Reflections and Future Work

Less Early Adopters. Intention to rent by just seeing the 360° video alone is low unless VR is mainstream. Possible use of the 360° VR as a supplement to face to face meetings

360° video is strongly favored for immersion factor. Better than 2D pictures and text on the web

Students wanted a full tour of the house including kitchen and bathroom

Focus on trust from student's perpective. Future work can also focus on landlord's perspective

Automating the Learning Schedule for Students via Chatbots

A learning guide that reminds when to study and motivates you
